text: We started with science,
we built our technology platform
but to do drug discovery.
Which will then allow us to discover

these molecules that we
think can be transformed into medicine.

That could benefit millions 
of people around the world.

Qubit Pharmaceuticals
is a TechBio company.

A company which uses
a technological platform,
but to do drug discovery.

Today, when we look at
existing technologies,

we can address about 20% of the
proteins and amino acids

present in the body and 
which have a role to play

in the initiation or in the
progression of a pathology.
That leaves us with 80% which are judged

too complex to be addressed
with current methods.

This quantum physics gives us
an unmatched level of precision,

which allows us to simulate
in a very precise way.

These proteins, their behaviour
and how they will interact
with molecules

allowing us to find
new molecules,

and therefore new treatments
for complex targets, which opens

a therapeutic potential which is
very important for patients.

Once we find
an interesting molecule,

we synthesise it,
we test it in real life.
And our real eureka moment
was to see that these molecules
which we had discovered by computer,

could be tested in real life, with 
positive experimental results.
However,

for the level of precision
that we have on our platform

of drug discovery, we need a
significant amount of computing power.

Today we have our own
computing cluster.

We have 200 graphics processing GPUs, 
but we continue to use AWS

We have 200 graphics processing GPUs, 
but we continue to use AWS

to have more capacity 
and flexibility,

but also to have access
to new machines.

Something which is a little
less known about us

is that we developed our own
quantum emulator.

Last year we were able to emulate 40 qubits
with our Hyperion 1 emulator

and we were able to test this emulator
on a quantum computer, thanks to AWS.

And so in terms of results
and impact.
We started with science,
we built our technology platform
and today we have a portfolio of seven
drug discovery programmes.

They have the potential of giving indication
in oncology and in inflammation

and we are particularly proud
of the fact that we can target RNA
with small molecules.

Which will really open up
a huge therapeutic field
for patients.

We also really want to
be at the forefront

of the discovery of future drugs,
so we continue to invest

in quantum chemistry, computer science
and quantum algorithms.

Which will allow us to have
even more precision and speed
in our discovery programmes.

And who knows, maybe we will be
the first company to use

quantum computing in production
for drug discovery.
